storyTitle: As a User, I want to receive notifications for task updates to stay informed about my responsibilities.

functional.title: Verify user receives in-app and email notifications when assigned task is updated
preconditions: User is logged into the system with valid credentials
User has at least one task assigned to them in the task management system
User has valid email address configured in their profile
Notification settings are enabled for task updates in user preferences
System notification service is running and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the task management dashboard and locate a task assigned to the test user
steps.expectedResult: Task list displays with at least one task assigned to the user

steps.action: As an admin or task owner, update the task by changing the due date from '2024-01-15' to '2024-01-20' and click 'Save' button
steps.expectedResult: Task is successfully updated and confirmation message 'Task updated successfully' appears

steps.action: Check the in-app notification bell icon in the top-right corner of the screen within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Red notification badge appears on bell icon with count '1' and notification displays: 'Task [Task Name] has been updated: Due date changed from 2024-01-15 to 2024-01-20'

steps.action: Check the user's email inbox within 1 minute of the task update
steps.expectedResult: Email notification received with subject 'Task Update: [Task Name]' containing details of the due date change

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Notification expands showing complete update details including timestamp, who made the change, and what was changed

postconditions: Notification is marked as delivered in the system logs
User remains logged in and on the notifications page
Task update is reflected in the task management database
Notification record is stored in notification history for the user

functional.title: Verify user can acknowledge receipt of task update notification
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has received at least one unacknowledged task update notification
Notification is visible in the in-app notification center
User has permission to acknowledge notifications

steps.action: Click on the notification bell icon in the top-right corner
steps.expectedResult: Notification dropdown panel opens displaying list of unread notifications with red dot indicators

steps.action: Locate the task update notification and click the 'Acknowledge' button or checkmark icon
steps.expectedResult: Notification status changes to 'Acknowledged' with green checkmark icon and timestamp showing when acknowledged

steps.action: Refresh the page and reopen the notification center
steps.expectedResult: Acknowledged notification moves to 'Read' section and notification count badge decreases by 1

steps.action: Navigate to notification history page via user profile menu
steps.expectedResult: Notification history displays the acknowledged notification with status 'Acknowledged' and acknowledgment timestamp

postconditions: Notification status is updated to 'Acknowledged' in the database
Acknowledgment timestamp is recorded in notification record
User remains on the notification history page
Notification count badge reflects accurate unread count

functional.title: Verify notifications include complete details of task updates for multiple field changes
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has a task assigned with fields: title, description, due date, priority, and status
User has notification permissions enabled
Task is in 'In Progress' status

steps.action: As task owner, navigate to the assigned task and click 'Edit' button
steps.expectedResult: Task edit form opens with all current field values populated

steps.action: Update multiple fields: change priority from 'Medium' to 'High', due date from '2024-01-20' to '2024-01-18', and add comment 'Urgent client request', then click 'Save Changes'
steps.expectedResult: Task updates are saved successfully with confirmation message 'Task updated with 3 changes'

steps.action: Check in-app notification within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Notification displays with title 'Task [Task Name] Updated' and detailed breakdown: 'Priority: Medium â†’ High', 'Due Date: 2024-01-20 â†’ 2024-01-18', 'Comment added: Urgent client request'

steps.action: Open the email notification received
steps.expectedResult: Email contains formatted table showing 'Field', 'Old Value', 'New Value' columns with all three changes listed, plus timestamp and updater name

steps.action: Click 'View Task' link in the notification
steps.expectedResult: System navigates directly to the updated task detail page showing all current values

postconditions: All task changes are persisted in the database
Notification record contains complete change history
User is on the task detail page
Task audit log records all field changes with timestamps

functional.title: Verify notifications are sent only for tasks assigned to the specific user
preconditions: Two users are logged into the system: User A and User B
User A has Task 1 assigned to them
User B has Task 2 assigned to them
Both users have notification settings enabled
Users are on different browser sessions

steps.action: As admin, update Task 1 (assigned to User A) by changing status from 'To Do' to 'In Progress'
steps.expectedResult: Task 1 status is updated successfully

steps.action: Check User A's notification center within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: User A receives notification: 'Task 1 status changed to In Progress' with notification badge showing '1'

steps.action: Check User B's notification center within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: User B has no new notifications and notification badge shows '0' - no notification for Task 1 update

steps.action: As admin, update Task 2 (assigned to User B) by changing priority to 'Critical'
steps.expectedResult: Task 2 priority is updated successfully

steps.action: Check User B's notification center within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: User B receives notification: 'Task 2 priority changed to Critical' with notification badge showing '1'

steps.action: Verify User A's notification center does not show Task 2 update
steps.expectedResult: User A still has only 1 notification (for Task 1) and does not see Task 2 notification

postconditions: Each user has received notifications only for their assigned tasks
Notification routing is correctly filtered by task assignment
Both users remain logged in on their respective sessions
Notification logs show correct user-task associations

functional.title: Verify notification history maintains chronological record of all task notifications
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has received at least 5 task update notifications over the past week
Notifications include both acknowledged and unacknowledged items
User has access to notification history page

steps.action: Click on user profile icon and select 'Notification History' from dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Notification History page loads displaying all notifications in reverse chronological order (newest first)

steps.action: Verify the list displays notification details including task name, update type, timestamp, and acknowledgment status
steps.expectedResult: Each notification entry shows: task title, change description, date/time stamp in format 'MM/DD/YYYY HH:MM AM/PM', and status badge (Acknowledged/Unread)

steps.action: Apply date filter to show notifications from 'Last 7 Days' using the filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: List refreshes to display only notifications from the past 7 days with count indicator showing 'Showing X notifications'

steps.action: Click on any notification entry to expand full details
steps.expectedResult: Notification expands showing complete change details, who made the update, before/after values, and direct link to the task

steps.action: Click 'Export History' button at top of page
steps.expectedResult: CSV file downloads containing all notification records with columns: Date, Task Name, Update Type, Details, Status

postconditions: Notification history remains accessible and unchanged
User remains on notification history page
CSV export file is saved to downloads folder
All notification records are preserved in the database

functional.title: Verify notifications are sent within 1 minute of task update detection per performance requirement
preconditions: User is logged into the system with active session
System notification service is running with normal load
User has a task assigned in 'To Do' status
System clock is synchronized and accurate
Performance monitoring tools are available to track notification delivery time

steps.action: Note the current system time (e.g., 10:30:00 AM) before making any changes
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded as baseline

steps.action: As task owner, update the task description and click 'Save' button, noting the exact save timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Task is saved successfully at recorded timestamp (e.g., 10:30:05 AM) with confirmation message

steps.action: Monitor the in-app notification bell icon continuously for the next 60 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Notification badge appears on bell icon within 60 seconds of task save

steps.action: Click on the notification and check the notification timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Notification timestamp shows delivery within 1 minute of task update (e.g., between 10:30:05 AM and 10:31:05 AM)

steps.action: Check email inbox and note the email received timestamp in email headers
steps.expectedResult: Email notification received timestamp is within 1 minute of task update time

steps.action: Review system logs at /api/tasks/notifications endpoint for delivery metrics
steps.expectedResult: Logs show notification processing time < 60 seconds with status 'Delivered' and exact delivery timestamp

postconditions: Performance metric is recorded showing notification delivered within SLA
System logs contain complete audit trail of notification delivery
User remains logged in and viewing notification
Notification delivery time meets the 1-minute performance requirement

negative.title: Verify system handles notification delivery when user email address is invalid or missing
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User profile has invalid email address 'invalid-email-format' or email field is empty
User has a task assigned to them
In-app notification service is operational

steps.action: As admin, update the task assigned to the user by changing priority from 'Low' to 'High'
steps.expectedResult: Task update is saved successfully in the system

steps.action: Check in-app notification center within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is delivered successfully showing 'Task priority changed to High' despite invalid email

steps.action: Check user's email inbox for notification
steps.expectedResult: No email is received due to invalid email address

steps.action: Review system error logs at /api/tasks/notifications endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Error log entry shows 'Email delivery failed: Invalid email address' with error code 400 and task notification ID

steps.action: Verify in-app notification shows warning icon indicating 'Email delivery failed - please update your email address in profile settings'
steps.expectedResult: Warning message is displayed in notification details prompting user to fix email configuration

postconditions: In-app notification is successfully delivered and stored
Email delivery failure is logged in system error logs
User is notified about email configuration issue
Task update is not affected by notification delivery failure

negative.title: Verify system behavior when user has disabled notification settings
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has navigated to Settings > Notifications page
User has disabled 'Task Update Notifications' toggle switch (set to OFF)
User has a task assigned to them
Notification settings are saved in user preferences

steps.action: Verify notification settings page shows 'Task Update Notifications' toggle is OFF with status 'Disabled'
steps.expectedResult: Settings page displays toggle in OFF position with gray color and text 'You will not receive task update notifications'

steps.action: As admin, update the user's assigned task by changing due date from '2024-01-20' to '2024-01-25'
steps.expectedResult: Task update is saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Wait 2 minutes and check the in-app notification bell icon
steps.expectedResult: No notification badge appears and notification count remains at 0

steps.action: Check user's email inbox for notification
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received

steps.action: Navigate to notification history page
steps.expectedResult: No new notification entry is created for the task update

steps.action: Review system logs to verify notification suppression
steps.expectedResult: Logs show entry 'Notification suppressed: User preferences disabled' with user ID and task ID

postconditions: No notifications are sent to user via any channel
User notification preferences remain disabled
Task update is successfully saved in database
System respects user's notification preference settings

negative.title: Verify system handles notification delivery when user session is expired or logged out
preconditions: User was previously logged into the system
User session has expired (timeout after 30 minutes of inactivity) or user has logged out
User has a task assigned to them
User has valid email address configured

steps.action: Verify user session is expired by attempting to access a protected page
steps.expectedResult: System redirects to login page with message 'Session expired. Please log in again.'

steps.action: As admin in separate session, update the user's task by changing status from 'In Progress' to 'Completed'
steps.expectedResult: Task status is updated successfully

steps.action: Verify email notification is sent to user's email address within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is delivered successfully with subject 'Task Update: [Task Name]' containing status change details

steps.action: User logs back into the system with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Login successful and user is redirected to dashboard

steps.action: Check in-app notification center immediately after login
steps.expectedResult: Notification badge shows '1' and notification displays 'Task status changed to Completed' with timestamp from when update occurred

steps.action: Verify notification shows as 'Unread' with red dot indicator
steps.expectedResult: Notification is marked as unread and queued for delivery upon user login

postconditions: Email notification was delivered despite expired session
In-app notification was queued and delivered upon user login
User is logged in and viewing notifications
Notification delivery is not blocked by session expiration

negative.title: Verify system handles notification when task update fails validation or is rolled back
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has a task assigned with due date '2024-01-20'
System has validation rules requiring due date to be in the future
Current system date is '2024-01-15'

steps.action: As admin, attempt to update task due date to a past date '2024-01-10' and click 'Save'
steps.expectedResult: System displays validation error message 'Due date cannot be in the past' in red banner and task update is rejected

steps.action: Wait 2 minutes and check user's in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: No notification is generated or sent to the user since task update failed validation

steps.action: Check user's email inbox
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received

steps.action: Review system logs at /api/tasks/notifications endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Logs show 'Task update failed validation - notification not triggered' with task ID and validation error details

steps.action: Verify task in database still has original due date '2024-01-20'
steps.expectedResult: Task due date remains unchanged at '2024-01-20' confirming rollback

postconditions: No notification is sent for failed task update
Task data remains in original state
Validation error is logged in system
User does not receive false notification for unsuccessful update

negative.title: Verify system handles notification delivery when notification service is down or unavailable
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has a task assigned to them
Notification service endpoint /api/tasks/notifications is unavailable or returning 503 Service Unavailable error
System monitoring shows notification service status as 'Down'

steps.action: Verify notification service status by checking system health dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Health dashboard shows 'Notification Service: Unavailable' with red status indicator

steps.action: As admin, update the user's task by changing priority from 'Medium' to 'Critical'
steps.expectedResult: Task update is saved successfully with confirmation message 'Task updated successfully'

steps.action: Wait 2 minutes and check user's in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: No notification appears in notification center and badge count remains at 0

steps.action: Check system error logs for notification delivery attempts
steps.expectedResult: Error logs show 'Notification delivery failed: Service unavailable (503)' with retry attempt counter and task update details

steps.action: Verify notification is queued in notification queue table in database
steps.expectedResult: Database query shows notification record with status 'Pending' and retry_count '3' indicating queued for retry

steps.action: Simulate notification service recovery and wait for retry mechanism to execute
steps.expectedResult: Once service is restored, queued notification is delivered to user with original timestamp and status changes to 'Delivered'

postconditions: Failed notification is queued for retry in database
Task update is successfully saved despite notification failure
System error logs contain complete failure and recovery audit trail
Notification is eventually delivered when service recovers

negative.title: Verify system prevents unauthorized users from acknowledging notifications belonging to other users
preconditions: User A is logged into the system with standard user role
User B has received a task update notification with notification ID 'NOTIF-12345'
User A attempts to access User B's notification via direct API call or URL manipulation
System has role-based access control enabled

steps.action: As User A, attempt to acknowledge User B's notification by sending POST request to /api/notifications/NOTIF-12345/acknowledge
steps.expectedResult: System returns HTTP 403 Forbidden error with message 'Access denied: You do not have permission to acknowledge this notification'

steps.action: Attempt to access User B's notification details by navigating to URL /notifications/NOTIF-12345
steps.expectedResult: System displays error page 'Access Denied' with message 'This notification does not belong to you' and redirects to User A's notification page

steps.action: Verify User B's notification status remains unchanged in database
steps.expectedResult: Database query shows notification NOTIF-12345 status is still 'Unread' and acknowledged_by field is NULL

steps.action: Check system security logs for unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Security log entry shows 'Unauthorized notification access attempt by User A (ID: XXX) for notification NOTIF-12345 owned by User B (ID: YYY)' with timestamp

steps.action: As User B, log in and verify notification is still unacknowledged
steps.expectedResult: User B sees notification with 'Unread' status and can successfully acknowledge it

postconditions: User B's notification remains unacknowledged and secure
Unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit trail
User A remains on their own notification page
System enforces proper authorization for notification access

negative.title: Verify system handles notification delivery when database connection is lost during notification creation
preconditions: User is logged into the system
User has a task assigned to them
Database connection is unstable or simulated to fail during notification write operation
System has database connection retry mechanism configured

steps.action: Simulate database connection failure by disconnecting database during task update operation
steps.expectedResult: Database connection is unavailable for write operations

steps.action: As admin, attempt to update the user's task by changing description to 'Updated description'
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Unable to save task update: Database connection error. Please try again.' and task update is not saved

steps.action: Verify no notification is created or sent to the user
steps.expectedResult: No in-app notification appears and no email is sent since task update transaction failed

steps.action: Check system error logs for database connection failure
steps.expectedResult: Error logs show 'Database connection lost during task update - transaction rolled back' with error code and timestamp

steps.action: Restore database connection and retry the task update
steps.expectedResult: Task update succeeds with confirmation message and notification is successfully generated and delivered to user

steps.action: Verify notification is delivered after successful retry
steps.expectedResult: User receives in-app and email notification with task update details within 1 minute of successful save

postconditions: Task update and notification creation are atomic - both succeed or both fail
No orphaned notifications exist for failed task updates
System error logs contain complete transaction failure details
Notification is delivered only after successful task update

steps.action: Verify notification content includes task name, update type, timestamp, and updater name for each notification

reliability.title: Notification Service Crash During Task Update - Recovery and Message Delivery Validation
reliability.description: Validate system resilience when notification service crashes during task update processing. Test message queue persistence, automatic service recovery, and guaranteed notification delivery after recovery. This ensures zero notification loss during service failures and validates MTTR compliance.
preconditions: Task management system is operational
Notification service is running with health monitoring enabled
Message queue (e.g., RabbitMQ/Kafka) is configured with persistence
At least 5 active users with tasks assigned
Chaos engineering tool (e.g., Chaos Monkey, Gremlin) is configured

steps.action: Establish baseline: Update 10 tasks and verify all notifications are delivered within 1 minute (steady state validation)
steps.expectedResult: All 10 notifications delivered successfully within SLO of 1 minute, confirming steady state

steps.action: Inject failure: Forcefully terminate notification service process while simultaneously updating 5 tasks
steps.expectedResult: Notification service crashes, task updates are persisted in message queue, no notifications delivered immediately

steps.action: Monitor system behavior: Verify health check detects failure and automatic restart mechanism triggers within 30 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Service orchestrator (Kubernetes/Docker Swarm) detects failure and initiates service restart within 30 seconds (MTTR validation)

steps.action: Validate recovery: After service restart, verify message queue replay and notification delivery for all 5 pending updates
steps.expectedResult: All 5 notifications are delivered within 2 minutes of service recovery, zero message loss confirmed

steps.action: Verify data integrity: Check notification history table for all 5 notifications with correct timestamps and delivery status
steps.expectedResult: All notifications logged with accurate metadata, delivery status marked as 'delivered', no duplicate notifications sent

postconditions: Notification service is fully operational
All pending notifications delivered successfully
Message queue is empty of pending notifications
System returns to steady state with <1 minute notification delivery
reliability.testData: Task IDs: TASK-001 to TASK-005, User IDs: USER-101 to USER-105, Update types: status change, assignee change, due date change
toolsRequired: Chaos Monkey or Gremlin for service termination
Message queue monitoring tool (RabbitMQ Management UI, Kafka Manager)
APM tool (New Relic, Datadog) for MTTR measurement
Database query tool for notification history validation

reliability.title: Database Connection Pool Exhaustion - Circuit Breaker and Graceful Degradation Validation
reliability.description: Test system behavior when task management database connection pool is exhausted due to high load or connection leaks. Validate circuit breaker activation, retry logic with exponential backoff, and graceful degradation to prevent cascading failures. Ensures notification service remains available even when database is under stress.
preconditions: Database connection pool configured with max 20 connections
Circuit breaker implemented with threshold of 50% failure rate over 10 requests
Retry policy configured with exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s)
Fallback mechanism available (cache or secondary read replica)
Load testing tool configured to simulate connection exhaustion

steps.action: Establish baseline: Generate 50 task updates and verify all notifications delivered with database response time <200ms
steps.expectedResult: All 50 notifications delivered successfully, database connection pool utilization at 40%, circuit breaker in CLOSED state

steps.action: Inject failure: Simulate connection pool exhaustion by creating 25 long-running database queries that hold connections for 60 seconds
steps.expectedResult: Connection pool reaches 100% utilization, new notification requests start failing with connection timeout errors

steps.action: Trigger task updates: Update 20 tasks during connection exhaustion period and monitor circuit breaker behavior
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker detects 50% failure rate after 10 requests and transitions to OPEN state within 5 seconds, preventing further database calls

steps.action: Validate retry logic: Monitor retry attempts with exponential backoff (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s) and verify fallback to cached task data or read replica
steps.expectedResult: System performs 4 retry attempts with correct backoff intervals, then activates fallback mechanism to retrieve task data from cache/replica

steps.action: Validate recovery: After 30 seconds (half-open timeout), verify circuit breaker transitions to HALF-OPEN and allows test requests
steps.expectedResult: Circuit breaker enters HALF-OPEN state, allows 3 test requests, all succeed as connections are released, circuit breaker returns to CLOSED state

steps.action: Verify notification delivery: Confirm all 20 notifications are eventually delivered within 90 seconds of task update
steps.expectedResult: All 20 notifications delivered successfully after circuit breaker recovery, no notifications lost, delivery SLO extended but within acceptable degraded performance

postconditions: Database connection pool returns to normal utilization (<50%)
Circuit breaker in CLOSED state
All pending notifications delivered
No connection leaks detected
System performance metrics return to baseline
reliability.testData: 20 task updates with IDs TASK-100 to TASK-119, User IDs USER-200 to USER-219, Long-running query: SELECT * FROM tasks WHERE SLEEP(60)
toolsRequired: Database connection pool monitor (HikariCP metrics, pgBouncer stats)
Circuit breaker dashboard (Hystrix Dashboard, Resilience4j metrics)
Load testing tool (JMeter, Gatling) for connection exhaustion
APM tool for retry pattern visualization

reliability.title: Network Partition Between Notification Service and Message Queue - Split-Brain Prevention
reliability.description: Chaos experiment to validate system behavior during network partition between notification service and message queue. Test message durability, duplicate notification prevention, and eventual consistency after partition heals. Validates blast radius containment and prevents split-brain scenarios where notifications might be sent multiple times.
preconditions: Notification service and message queue deployed in separate network segments
Network chaos tool (Pumba, Toxiproxy) configured for partition injection
Message queue configured with at-least-once delivery guarantee
Idempotency keys implemented for notification deduplication
Monitoring dashboards for message queue lag and notification delivery rates

steps.action: Define hypothesis: 'During network partition, notifications will be queued locally and delivered after partition heals with zero duplicates and <5 minute total delay'
steps.expectedResult: Hypothesis documented with success criteria: zero message loss, zero duplicates, MTTR <5 minutes

steps.action: Establish steady state: Update 15 tasks and measure baseline notification delivery time (target: <1 minute) and success rate (target: 100%)
steps.expectedResult: Baseline established: 15/15 notifications delivered in average 45 seconds, 100% success rate

steps.action: Inject network partition: Use Toxiproxy to block all traffic between notification service and message queue for 3 minutes
steps.expectedResult: Network partition active, notification service cannot reach message queue, connection attempts timeout after 10 seconds

steps.action: Generate task updates during partition: Update 10 tasks and monitor notification service behavior (local queuing, error handling)
steps.expectedResult: Notification service detects message queue unavailability, stores 10 notifications in local persistent queue or database, logs partition event

steps.action: Heal partition: Remove network partition and monitor automatic reconnection and message replay
steps.expectedResult: Notification service reconnects to message queue within 30 seconds, replays 10 queued notifications with idempotency keys

steps.action: Validate notification delivery: Verify all 10 notifications delivered exactly once within 5 minutes of original task update
steps.expectedResult: All 10 notifications delivered successfully, zero duplicates confirmed via idempotency key tracking, total delay <5 minutes, hypothesis validated

steps.action: Verify blast radius: Confirm other system components (task management, user authentication) remained operational during partition
steps.expectedResult: Blast radius contained to notification delivery only, core task management functionality unaffected, no cascading failures detected

postconditions: Network partition removed
Notification service and message queue fully connected
All pending notifications delivered
No duplicate notifications in user notification history
System returns to steady state performance
reliability.testData: 10 task updates: TASK-200 to TASK-209, Users: USER-300 to USER-309, Idempotency keys: UUID format for each notification
toolsRequired: Toxiproxy or Pumba for network partition injection
Database query tool to verify idempotency key uniqueness
Distributed tracing tool (Jaeger, Zipkin) for message flow visualization
Chaos experiment tracking tool (Chaos Toolkit, LitmusChaos)

reliability.title: Notification Service Crash Mid-Transaction - Data Consistency and RPO Validation
reliability.description: Validate data consistency and Recovery Point Objective (RPO) compliance when notification service crashes during notification persistence transaction. Test transaction rollback, notification history integrity, and ensure no partial or corrupted notification records. Validates RPO of zero data loss for committed transactions.
preconditions: Database configured with ACID transaction support
Notification history table with transactional integrity constraints
Write-ahead logging (WAL) enabled for crash recovery
Backup mechanism configured with point-in-time recovery
Chaos tool capable of precise timing for mid-transaction crash

steps.action: Establish baseline: Create 20 task updates and verify all notification records persisted correctly in notification_history table with complete metadata
steps.expectedResult: 20 complete notification records in database with status='delivered', all foreign key constraints satisfied, no orphaned records

steps.action: Inject failure: Initiate 5 task updates, then crash notification service precisely during database transaction commit phase (after INSERT but before COMMIT)
steps.expectedResult: Notification service crashes mid-transaction, database connection terminated abruptly

steps.action: Validate automatic rollback: Query notification_history table immediately after crash to verify uncommitted transactions are rolled back
steps.expectedResult: Zero partial records in database, all uncommitted transactions automatically rolled back by database engine, referential integrity maintained

steps.action: Restart notification service and verify recovery: Check that service replays messages from queue and successfully persists all 5 notifications
steps.expectedResult: Service restarts within 30 seconds, processes 5 pending notifications from message queue, all 5 records successfully committed to database

steps.action: Validate RPO compliance: Verify zero data loss for committed transactions and confirm all notifications have consistent state (no duplicates, no missing fields)
steps.expectedResult: RPO of zero achieved: all committed notifications before crash are intact, all uncommitted notifications successfully retried and committed, no data corruption detected

steps.action: Verify notification delivery: Confirm all 5 users received notifications and notification_history matches actual delivery status
steps.expectedResult: All 5 notifications delivered to users, notification_history table shows accurate delivery timestamps and status, audit trail complete

postconditions: Notification service operational
Database in consistent state with no orphaned records
All notifications accounted for in notification_history
Transaction logs show proper rollback and replay
RPO validation passed with zero data loss
reliability.testData: 5 task updates: TASK-500 to TASK-504, Users: USER-600 to USER-604, Notification metadata: task_id, user_id, update_type, timestamp, delivery_status
toolsRequired: Database transaction monitor (PostgreSQL pg_stat_activity, MySQL SHOW PROCESSLIST)
Chaos tool with precise timing control (Gremlin, custom script)
Database query tool for transaction log analysis
Backup validation tool for point-in-time recovery testing

userStoryObject.title: As a User, I want to receive notifications for task updates to stay informed about my responsibilities.
userStoryObject.description:
CONTEXT & BACKGROUND: This story ensures that users are kept up-to-date with any changes to their tasks, enhancing collaboration. CURRENT STATE: Users currently miss updates on task changes, leading to confusion and delays. DESIRED STATE: Users receive immediate notifications about task updates, allowing for timely action. KEY FUNCTIONALITY: â€¢ Automatic detection of task updates â€¢ Immediate notification dispatch to users â€¢ Clear description of the update â€¢ Historical record of task notifications USER INTERACTION FLOW: 1. Task is updated in the system. 2. System detects the update. 3. Notification is generated and sent to the user. 4. User receives the notification and takes necessary action. TECHNICAL CONSIDERATIONS: â€¢ Data source: Task management database â€¢ Validation rules: Ensure notifications are sent only for confirmed task updates â€¢ API endpoints: /api/tasks/notifications â€¢ Security: User authentication required for notification access â€¢ Performance: Notifications sent within 1 minute of task update detection. OUT OF SCOPE: â€¢ Manual task update processes SUCCESS METRICS: â€¢ 95% of users report receiving notifications within 1 minute of task updates.

Persona: User (User)
userStoryObject.acceptanceCriteria:
Criteria 1: System sends notifications for any updates made to tasks assigned to users.

Criteria 2: Users receive notifications via both email and in-app alerts.

Criteria 3: Notifications include details of the task update.

Criteria 4: Users can acknowledge receipt of the notification.
